content: प्रलयः {@--1@} Destruction, annihilation, dissolution; स्यानानि किं हिमवतः प्रलयं गतानि <ls>Bh. 3. 70</ls>, <ls n="Bh. 3.">69</ls>; प्रलयं नीत्वा <ls>Śi. 11. 66</ls> ‘causing to disappear’. {@--2@} The destruction of the whole universe (at the end of a {%kalpa%}), universal destruction; <ls>Ku. 2. 8</ls>; <ls>Bg. 7. 6.</ls> {@--3@} Any extensive destruction or devastation. {@--4@} Death, dying, destruction; प्रारब्धाः प्रलयाय मांसवदहो विक्रेतुमेते वयं <ls>Mu. 5. 21</ls>; <ls n="Mu.">1. 14</ls>; <ls>Bg. 14. 14.</ls> {@--5@} Swoon, fainting, loss of consciousness, syncope; प्रलयांतोन्मिषिते विलोचने <ls>Ku. 4. 2.</ls> {@--6@} (In <ab>Rhet.</ab>) Loss of consciousness, considered as one of the 33 subordinate feelings; प्रलयः सुखदुःखाद्यैर्गाढमिंद्रियमूर्छनं <ls>Pratāparudra</ls>. {@--7@} The mystic syllable {%om%}.
